framework

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Input, processing.core.PConstants

    public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object
implements Input
    This class implements the base Camera functionality. It controls the position and view direction of the camera in your Scene. You may add functionality by creating a new class that inherits Camera, e.g. public class MyCamera extends Camera. You should not edit this class directly.

    Since Camera implements the interface Input, you will not need to explicitly add this to your subclass. Similarly, it is not necessary to define all Input handling functions in your subclass.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    wil

      • Camera

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Called by Scene parent to position camera.

        Sets up position (eye), look at (cen= eye + view) and up vector (up) and updates Scene viewing.

        See Also:
        update(float), reset()

      • update

        public void update(float dT)
        Update the position of the camera and look-at vectors based on keyboard input.
        Parameters:
        dT - (∆T) change in time since previous call (unused)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets Camera vectors to default values. Sets position of camera at (0,0) in x,y-plane and puts z-position at 0.5*height/tan(π/6) which puts the coordinate width and height of window into view (if projection is in perspective view, and both fovy = 60° and aspect = width/height)

        width and height refer to the window size of Scene parent.

      • calculateVectors

        protected final void calculateVectors()
        Calculates planar camera axes based on view direction.

        up points up in y-direction, forward follows view direction along the y-plane and right is the cross product of up and forward. The vectors are orthonormal. 

                up  forward
        |  /
        | /
        |/_ _ _ right
        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.
        See Also:
        reset()

      • handleKey

        public void handleKey(char key,
                      int state,
                      int mX,
                      int mY)
        Captures input from wasd-keys used for camera movement.

        Spacebar resets the camera.

        Specified by:
        handleKey in interface Input
        Parameters:
        key - ASCII character from keyboard input
        state - 1 if key down, 0 if key up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        Input.handleSpecialKey(int keyCode, int state, int mX, int mY)

      • handleMouse

        public void handleMouse(int button,
                        int state,
                        int mX,
                        int mY)
        Captures button click. Sets button to 0 if last mouse button is released. Saves current position of mouse at click.
        Specified by:
        handleMouse in interface Input
        Parameters:
        button - mouse button (LEFT, RIGHT or CENTER)
        state - 1 if mouse down, 0 if mouse up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleMouseDrag(int, int)

      • handleMouseDrag

        public void handleMouseDrag(int mX,
                            int mY)
        Called when mouse is moved (while a button is pressed down). Functionality currently only for LEFT mouse click.

        Calculates difference in mouse position since last call and adjusts camera view accordingly. Sensitivity is fixed at 0.01f.

        Specified by:
        handleMouseDrag in interface Input
        Parameters:
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        handleMouse(int, int, int, int)

      • handleSpecialKey

        public void handleSpecialKey(int keyCode,
                             int state,
                             int mX,
                             int mY)
        Description copied from interface: Input
        Called when keyboard input is received from special (non-ASCII) characters.

        keyCode constants: (arrow keys) UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, ALT, CTRL, SHIFT, PAGE_UP, PAGE_DOWN, HOME, END

        Example implementation: 

                void handleKey(int keyCode, int state, int mX, int mY){
            if (state == 1){ // if key pressed down
                switch(keyCode){ // special key
                    case LEFT:
                        parent.translate(-1.f,0.f,0.f); // go left
                        break;
                    case RIGHT:
                        parent.translate(1.f,0.f,0.f); // go right
                        break;
                }
            }
        }
        Specified by:
        handleSpecialKey in interface Input
        Parameters:
        keyCode - coded keyboard input based on KeyEvent
        state - 1 if key down, 0 if key up
        mX - X coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        mY - Y coordinate of mouse in rendering window
        See Also:
        Input.handleKey(char key, int state, int mX, int mY)

        Description copied from interface: Input
